subject: Science
title: Harlow's Monkeys: The Need for Comfort
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Harlow's Monkeys: The Need for Comfort.

hook.text: Harry Harlow gave baby monkeys two fake mothers ‚Äî one with food, one with soft cloth.

buildup.text: In the 1950s, experts believed love was just a response to being fed.

discovery.text: The monkeys chose the soft cloth mother almost every time ‚Äî only visiting the wire one for food.

twist.text: When frightened, they ran to the cloth mother. Comfort, not food, was what they truly needed.

climax.text: This proved that emotional attachment is a fundamental need ‚Äî not just a learned behavior.

punchline.text: Love isn't about food. Baby monkeys proved comfort matters more than calories.

quiz.question: What did Harlow's monkey experiment prove?
